meanings.def: to press something so hard that it is damaged or injured, or loses its shape
examples: The car was completely crushed under the truck.
Several people were crushed to death in the accident.
He was crushed beneath a bus.
His hand was badly crushed in the accident.
She was crushed between two cars.
insects that had been crushed underfoot

meanings.def: to break something into small pieces or into a powder by pressing hard
examples: Add two cloves of crushed garlic.
They crush the olives with a heavy wooden press.
Crush the garlic finely before adding.
Crush the biscuits finely before adding them to the mixture.

meanings.def: to push or press somebody/something into a small space
examples: Over twenty prisoners were crushed into a small dark cell.
She was crushed against the wall.

meanings.def: to make something full of folds or lines; to become full of folds or lines
examples: She crushed the scrap of paper in her hand.
The crisp paper crushed like eggshells in his fingers.

meanings.def: to use violent methods to defeat people who are opposing you
examples: The army was sent in to crush the rebellion.
Attempts to crush serious popular unrest led to civil war.
The government succeeded in crushing the military rising.

meanings.def: to destroy somebody’s confidence or happiness
examples: She felt completely crushed by the teacher's criticism.
He always has this fantastic energy. Nothing can crush him.
Their new self-confidence could not be crushed.

meanings.def: to do something very well or be very successful
examples: She got up on stage and absolutely crushed it—the audience was going wild!
His latest film is crushing it at the box office.

idioms.def: to do something very well or be very successful
examples: She got up on stage and absolutely crushed it—the audience was going wild!
His latest film is crushing it at the box office.

meanings.def: a crowd of people pressed close together in a small space
examples: There was a big crush in the theatre bar.
I couldn't find a way through the crush.
66 fans died in the crush on the steps of the stadium.
There's always a big crush in the bar during the interval.

meanings.def: a strong feeling of love, that usually does not last very long, that a young person has for somebody older
examples: It's only a schoolgirl crush, it'll pass.
I had a huge crush on her.

meanings.def: a drink made from fruit juice
